entries.title: Kenneth Rowe, Who Defected From North Korea With His Jet, Dies at 90
entries.description: Two months after the Korean War armistice, he handed America an intelligence bonanza with his headline-making flight in a Soviet-made MIG.

entries.title: U.S. Officials Repatriate a Looted Relic to the Palestinian Authority
entries.description: As the object, a carved spoon, was handed back at a ceremony in Bethlehem, officials said it was the first time the United States had repatriated an antiquity to the Palestinian government.

entries.title: For the State Department, Now It’s Türkiye, Not Turkey
entries.description: The department will use the Turkish-language spelling in “most formal, diplomatic, and bilateral contexts” after a request from the country’s embassy, a spokesman said.

entries.title: Your Friday Briefing: Russia Proposes a Short Cease-Fire
entries.description: Also, Kevin McCarthy loses yet another bid to become House speaker, and the week in culture.

entries.title: El Chapo’s Son Is Captured by Mexican Authorities for 2nd Time
entries.description: The arrest of Ovidio Guzmán López was a victory for the Mexican government. He had been briefly detained in 2019, but was released after cartel gunmen overpowered law enforcement.

entries.title: Twin Car Explosions Kill More than 20 in Somalia
entries.description: A terrorist group, Al Shabab, claimed responsibility for the attacks, which came as the militants lose control of towns and villages to a government offensive.

entries.title: Church Lays Benedict to Rest, if Not Its Divisions
entries.description: An extraordinary period for the modern church ended with Francis presiding over the funeral of his retired predecessor. Some conservatives found the ceremony too modest for their standard-bearer.

entries.title: Some find fault with Francis’ homily for Benedict.
entries.description: The former pope’s conservative supporters said Francis’ approach seemed paltry in comparison to Benedict’s homily at the funeral of Pope John Paul II.

entries.title: El Chapo’s Son Is Captured by Mexican Authorities for 2nd Time
entries.description: The arrest of Ovidio Guzmán López was a victory for the Mexican government. He had been briefly detained in 2019, but was released after cartel gunmen overpowered law enforcement.

entries.title: Sunak Makes Sweeping Pledges to Britons, Promising Path to Prosperity
entries.description: His promises represented an effort to regain momentum at a time of steep challenges for Britain, but some pressing problems, like the National Health Service, defy easy solutions.

entries.title: How a Nuclear Dump in Taiwan Created a Generation of Activists
entries.description: For members of a Taiwanese tribe, a waste site on their island serves as a painful reminder of the government’s broken promises, and a symbol of their long struggle for greater autonomy.

entries.title: Biden Will Announce New Border Policies to Reduce Illegal Crossings
entries.description: President Biden is under increasing pressure to confront historic surges of people at the border.

entries.title: In a phone call with Putin, Turkey’s president calls for a cease-fire.
France Promises Ukraine Armored Vehicles, U.S. Weighs Doing the Same
entries.description: President Emmanuel Macron pledged to provide AMX-10 RC armored vehicles, though Mr. Macron’s office did not specify how many of the vehicles would be delivered or when.

entries.title: Russia Pardons Some Prisoners Who Fought in Ukraine, Reports Say
entries.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the Wagner paramilitary group, is seen in a video congratulating men for completing their military contracts.

entries.title: Prince Harry’s Book Describes Physical Attack by William, According to Report
entries.description: “He knocked me to the floor,” Harry recounts of the alleged assault by Prince William, according to The Guardian, which said it had obtained a copy of Harry’s coming book.

entries.title: Most of Bakhmut Has Been Destroyed in Ukraine War, Official Says
entries.description: Russia has continued to press an offensive aimed at capturing the eastern city, after suffering a string of setbacks elsewhere in Ukraine in recent months.

entries.title: Violence in the N.F.L.
entries.description: In professional football, danger is at the root of any given play.

entries.title: France Pledges More Military Support for Ukraine
entries.description: President Emmanuel Macron promised to send more armored combat vehicles, and President Biden confirmed that the U.S. is considering supplying Bradley Fighting Vehicles.

entries.title: Live Updates: Pope Offers ‘Final Farewell’ to Benedict at Funeral Mass
entries.description: Pope Francis is the first to preside over a Mass for a predecessor who resigned. The ceremony resembled the funeral of a reigning pontiff, with some significant exceptions.

entries.title: Pope Francis’ Homily for Benedict Calls Him a ‘Faithful Friend’ of Jesus
entries.description: Pope Francis’ short speech honored the former pontiff, whose life’s work was meditating on the life of Jesus, and who faced many challenges before retiring in 2013.

entries.title: The Funeral for Pope Benedict XVI in Pictures
entries.description: Benedict XVI was laid to rest in a ceremony that marked the end of an unusual arrangement during which he lived on the Vatican grounds after having resigned in 2013.

entries.title: Your Thursday Briefing
entries.description: The Russian authorities have laid the blame for a deadly Ukrainian strike on their soldiers themselves.

entries.title: Ukraine Finds Sexual Crimes Where Russian Troops Ruled
entries.description: Russian officials have denied abuses against civilians despite widespread evidence of sexual violence by Russian troops documented by Ukrainian and international investigators.

entries.title: Ukraine Claims Heavy Russian Losses in Waves of Missile Strikes
entries.description: Kyiv says its forces have killed or wounded more than 1,000 Russian soldiers in a series of pinpoint attacks. Russia has confirmed only one of three waves of strikes.
